subject: remove 'users' group from the list of users in /etc/group
commitMessage:
remove 'users' group from the list of users in /etc/group 

/etc/group file defines the groups to which users belong.
Currently 'users' group is wrongly listed in lists of users.

This has no effect and it can be removed to clean up that file.

Change-Id: I19268872471b886f5914ea40fe6021c7b9c6fa7b
Signed-off-by: Corentin Lecouvey <corentin.lecouvey@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Patch Set 1:

ping ?

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Could you please make the commit message a little bit more verbose and clear. I suppose summary like

 Remove certain system users from the 'users' group

Is more appropriate too.
Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated

Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Lukasz, your last commit title proposal shows that it was really not clear. Hope it is clearer now.

Thanks for the review.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Indeed neither Linux nor libc support nested group and making 'users' group a member of other groups makes no sense at all.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Bug-Tizen: 
is welcome too

Patch Set 2:

Can someone merge it?

Patch Set 2:

I am not granted too
Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased

Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

I'm OK to merge. Please +1 Verify after my rebase.
Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2
Patch Set 3: Verified+1
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Add security-containers user
commitMessage:
Add security-containers user

The purpose of this user is to ensure an existence of a static UID
for dbus communication between the host and LXC containers.

Change-Id: I44182878f9f0a9fc59b394fc09a8e8f404b0e4c7
Signed-off-by: Michal Witanowski <m.witanowski@samsung.com>

subject: Add a buxton user and group
commitMessage:
Add a buxton user and group

The buxton daemon runs as the "buxton" user, and it must write to the
/var/lib/buxton directory, which will be owned by user "buxton", so make
sure this user is defined.

Add a group as well so that we can set the group owner to "buxton" on
/var/lib/buxton.

Change-Id: I4a117bcbbc0aba12d8a60d69d8b05b378a235367
Signed-off-by: Patrick McCarty <patrick.mccarty@linux.intel.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Verified that the user and group are initialized properly in a local IVI image that I created.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

No objections.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Make /etc/mtab a symbolic link to /proc/self/mounts
commitMessage:
Make /etc/mtab a symbolic link to /proc/self/mounts

Currently systemd and tools from util-linux expect /etc/mtab to be a
link to /proc/self/mounts.

Change-Id: If0fd0139d952531fb26ab94e4fa6d9657ce88043
Signed-off-by: Łukasz Stelmach <l.stelmach@samsung.com>

subject: Add system users ammended to include some additional mobile users also added in app user as per Anas reset home directories for other users to /var/lib/empty
commitMessage:
Add system users ammended to include some additional mobile users
also added in app user as per Anas reset home directories for
other users to /var/lib/empty

Signed-off-by: Anas Nashif <anas.nashif@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Michael Demeter <michael.demeter@intel.com>
Change-Id: I67efe01517278778fc6d40ba7fed0a205849f18e

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       armv7hl        succeeded      

 standard       x86_64         succeeded      

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1:

please review things here, the other request was merged by mistake and now reverted. So this is a new request.

Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

We're importing broken things.  These app users are fictitious and this /opt/ business is deplorable.

Patch Set 1:

glad that someone else shares that opinion. What is the solution you are proposing to get WRT working and how are we going to do about usage of /opt and builtin users most of the middleware depends on? I am all ready to do the +1 on any other solution...

Patch Set 1:

We have to work in stages.  I have WRT apps working on wayland right now with the exception that you have to run them as root or else manually fix the ownership of the wrt and ace databases in /opt/dbspace/.

Either we allow my change to just change the wrt packages to use the existing groups/users or we move back to the old groups and users on the system.  It is not ok to take a purist approach and say that wrt apps have to stay broken until several months of redesigning is complete

Patch Set 1:

Rusty: your change is just hardcoding to some other user and will break others and is only relevant for WRT while mobile depends on other apps and the complete stack, so might help you short term, but will break others.

Never like all of this hardcoding and I am submitting this change with mixed feelings if you want, but I agree with you that we should do things in stages and with no alternative solution in sight, we have to at least reproduce what we have right now and try to fix as much as possible to make this suck less.

Patch Set 1:

Rusty: your change is just hardcoding to some other user and will break others and is only relevant for WRT while mobile depends on other apps and the complete stack, so might help you short term, but will break others.

Never like all of this hardcoding and I am submitting this change with mixed feelings if you want, but I agree with you that we should do things in stages and with no alternative solution in sight, we have to at least reproduce what we have right now and try to fix as much as possible to make this suck less.

Patch Set 1:

oops, double post...

Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Can we fork this for IVI which has a valid business case for this... But let us not proliferate it through all of Tizen 3.0....

Patch Set 1:

PC is also a valid business case and MOBILE heavily depends on it . Do you have an alternate solution for how to make this work short term?, Otherwise we have take what is in Tizen 2.x and evolve from there in a managed and organised way.

Patch Set 1:

I am a bit confused, we currently encounter quite the same issue Rusty described. But I thought we were supposed to first work with single user support to reach an acceptable run-time status, before integrate multi-users support.
Am I mistaken?

Patch Set 1:

Even though this adds various user accounts, this is not adding multiuser support.  This is just restoring the user/group structure used in tizen 2.1 with things like "all apps run as user 'apps'"

Patch Set 1:

After discussion it the security team recommendation that we run these programs as root instead of adding the groups/users from 2.1 into the Tizen 3.0 code line. This alternative will allow us to work towards a real solution instead of dealing with something that once it is put into the codeline it will become the defacto standard and all but impossible to extricate.
Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Restored

restoring
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

reviewer.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

comments.message:
Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

app user should be member of video group.
if not if you launch widget by wrt_launcher, it should fail.
Uploaded patch set 3.

Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)
Uploaded patch set 4.
Uploaded patch set 5.
Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I don't see the app user in /etc/passwd.

Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

need app user and need to make sure all home directories for users exist, if home is not needed, point it to some equivelant of dev/null

Patch Set 5:

on opensuse for example, /var/lib/empty is used for homes of users where home is actually populated with data. fedora uses /var/empty/<user name>

Patch Set 5:

The home directory and symlink is created filesystem package  https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/#/c/5991/

Patch Set 5:

not for all other users...
I have been working on other fundamental changes to both those packages which will fail if a home directory is not present, so this change will fail.
Uploaded patch set 6.
Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 6:

Are you going to create all those home directories? How about point them to /var/lib/empty for that and add this to filesystem as well

Patch Set 6:

Can't +1 as I don't know which users created here require an actual home directory or could live with a symlink pointing /home/user to /var/lib/empty instead. Most of them are not covered in the filesystem package yet. Withdrawing my +1 there as well.
Uploaded patch set 7.
Uploaded patch set 8.
Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 8: Verified+1
Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
